Course Description: THIS COURSE IS DESIGNED TO TEACH STUDENTS TO ACCOMPLISH COMMON ACCOUNTING FUNCTIONS THROUGH THE USE OF THE COMPUTER. STUDENTS WILL LEARN TO MAINTAIN ACCOUNTING RECORDS ON A COMPUTER, INPUT AND PROCESS INFORMATION AND PRODUCE STANDARD ACCOUNTING REPORTS. THIS COURSE COVERS COMMON ACCOUNTING FUNCTIONS SUCH AS MAINTAINING ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE, ACCOUNTS PAYABLE AND GENERAL LEDGERS.
Textbook(s):
YACHT, CAROL (2006).  COMPUTER ACCOUNTING WITH PEACHTREE COMPLETE 2006 (10TH ED.). MCGRAW-HILL/IRWIN.  ISBN:  0073288519.

YACHT, CAROL, & CROSSON, SUSAN (2006).  COMPUTER ACCOUNTING ESSENTIALS USING QUICKBOOKS (3RD ED.).  MCGRAW-HILL/IRWIN.  ISBN:  0073131121.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
